title: Non-unital rings ("rngs")
content: According to Wikipedia, "... in abstract algebra, a _rng_ (or pseudo-ring or non-unital ring) is an algebraic structure satisfying the same properties as a [[unital] ring, without assuming the existence of a multiplicative identity. The term "rng" (pronounced rung) is meant to suggest that it is a "ring" without "i", i.e. without the requirement for an "identity element"." (see ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rng_(algebra) , 6-Jan-2020).

blocks.name: crng
blocks.content: Extend class notation with class of all non-unital rings.

blocks.name: df-rng0
blocks.content: Define class of all (non-unital) rings. A _non-unital ring_ (or rng, or pseudoring) is a set equipped with two everywhere-defined internal operations, whose first one is an additive abelian group operation and the second one is a multiplicative semigroup operation, and where the addition is left- and right-distributive for the multiplication. Definition of a pseudo-ring in section I.8.1 of [BourbakiAlg1] p. 93 or the definition of a ring in part Preliminaries of [Roman] p. 18. As almost always in mathematics, "non-unital" means "not necessarily unital". Therefore, by talking about a ring (in general) or a non-unital ring the "unital" case is always included. In contrast to a unital ring, the commutativity of addition must be postulated and cannot be proven from the other conditions. (Contributed by AV, 6-Jan-2020.)

thm isringrng(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Ring ↔(c0 ∈ Rng ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1)))))
  ⊣ c1 =(Base ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(× ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
} = {
  impbii(c0 ∈ Ring, (c0 ∈ Rng ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1)))))
  jca(c0 ∈ Ring, c0 ∈ Rng, ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1))))
  ringrng(c0)
  syl(c0 ∈ Ring, ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1))), ∃!(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1))))
  ringideu(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2)
  reurex(s0, c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1)))
  syl3anbrc((c0 ∈ Rng ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1)))), c0 ∈ Ring, c0 ∈ Grp, (mulGrp ` c0)∈ Mnd, ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, ∀(hs0 ∈ c1,((s0[c2](s1[(+ ` c0)]hs0))=((s0[c2]s1)[(+ ` c0)](s0[c2]hs0))∧((s0[(+ ` c0)]s1)[c2]hs0)=((s0[c2]hs0)[(+ ` c0)](s1[c2]hs0)))))))
  adantr(c0 ∈ Rng, ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1))), c0 ∈ Grp)
  syl(c0 ∈ Rng, c0 ∈ Grp, c0 ∈ Abel)
  rngabl(c0)
  ablgrp(c0)
  sylibr((c0 ∈ Rng ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1)))), (mulGrp ` c0)∈ Mnd, ((mulGrp ` c0)∈ SGrp ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1)))))
  anim1i(c0 ∈ Rng, ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1))), (mulGrp ` c0)∈ SGrp)
  rngmgp(c0, (mulGrp ` c0))
  ismnddef(s0, s1, (mulGrp ` c0), c1, c2)
  mgpbas(c1, (mulGrp ` c0), c0)
  mgpplusg(c2, (mulGrp ` c0), c0)
  adantr(c0 ∈ Rng, ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1,((s0[c2]s1)= s1 ∧(s1[c2]s0)= s1))), ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, ∀(hs0 ∈ c1,((s0[c2](s1[(+ ` c0)]hs0))=((s0[c2]s1)[(+ ` c0)](s0[c2]hs0))∧((s0[(+ ` c0)]s1)[c2]hs0)=((s0[c2]hs0)[(+ ` c0)](s1[c2]hs0)))))))
  simp3bi(c0 ∈ Rng, ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, ∀(hs0 ∈ c1,((s0[c2](s1[(+ ` c0)]hs0))=((s0[c2]s1)[(+ ` c0)](s0[c2]hs0))∧((s0[(+ ` c0)]s1)[c2]hs0)=((s0[c2]hs0)[(+ ` c0)](s1[c2]hs0)))))), c0 ∈ Abel, (mulGrp ` c0)∈ SGrp)
  isrng(s0, s1, hs0, c0, (mulGrp ` c0), c1, c2, (+ ` c0))

blocks.name: rngcl
blocks.content: Closure of the multiplication operation of a nonunital ring. (Contributed by AV, 17-Apr-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm rngcl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, crng), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cmulr, c0))
} = {
  syl3an1(wcel(c0, crng), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2), wcel(cfv(cmgp, c0), cmgm))
  syl(wcel(c0, crng), wcel(cfv(cmgp, c0), cmgm), wcel(cfv(cmgp, c0), csgrp))
  rngmgp(c0, cfv(cmgp, c0))
  sgrpmgm(cfv(cmgp, c0))
  mgmcl(cfv(cmgp, c0), c1, c2, c3, c4)
  mgpbas(c2, cfv(cmgp, c0), c0)
  mgpplusg(c4, cfv(cmgp, c0), c0)
  eqid(cfv(cmgp, c0))
}

  sgrpmgm((mulGrp ` c0))

  mgpbas(c2, (mulGrp ` c0), c0)
  mgpplusg(c4, (mulGrp ` c0), c0)
